headline: Technip Energies announces the appointment of Jesse Stanley as President, Technologies & Products, and the new composition of its Executive Committee
summary: Jesse Stanley Jesse Stanley President, Technologies & Products Technip Energies (PARIS: TE) today announces the appointment of Jesse Stanley as President, Technologies & Products (T&P) Business Unit and member of the Executive Committee as of March 16, 2026, as well as the new composition of its Executive Committee. headline: Telecom's Greenest Vendors Research Report 2026: Assessment of Sustainability Performance for 49 Telcos - Ciena, Cisco, Ericsson and Nokia Lead, While Chinese Vendors & Fiber Suppliers Lag
summary: Telcos can boost sustainability by focusing on supply chain emissions, as these account for 66% of their carbon footprint. The shift to software-centric operations and energy-efficient 5G solutions offers significant progress. headline: Accenture: India Is 'Taking the Lead' in AI Adoption
summary: India has been innovative in adopting AI through its regulation, AI infrastructure, and its use of AI in the education sector says Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO. The company has been expanding its presence in the country in recent years, and now has over 350,000 employees in India. Julie spoke to Bloomberg TV's Haslinda Amin on the sidelines of the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi.

content.title: Accenture: India Is 'Taking the Lead' in AI Adoption

Julie spoke to Bloomberg TV's Haslinda Amin on the sidelines of the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi.

headline: Macron Is Setting Up a G-7 Showdown With Trump Over Social Media
summary: The French leader said Thursday that protecting children from the harms of social media and artificial intelligence will be a priority for his country’s Group of Seven presidency, in a direct challenge to the Trump administration, which has lined up with US tech firms and made free speech a cornerstone of its foreign policy.  “There is no reason our children should be exposed online to what is legally forbidden in the real world,” Macron said at the India AI Summit in New Delhi.

content.title: Macron Is Setting Up a G-7 Showdown With Trump Over Social Media
content.summary: The French leader said Thursday that protecting children from the harms of social media and artificial intelligence will be a priority for his country’s Group of Seven presidency, in a direct challenge to the Trump administration, which has lined up with US tech firms and made free speech a cornerstone of its foreign policy.  “There is no reason our children should be exposed online to what is legally forbidden in the real world,” Macron said at the India AI Summit in New Delhi.

headline: Accenture combats AI refuseniks by linking promotions to log-ins
summary: Accenture has begun monitoring staff use of its AI tools as part of how it decides top-level promotions, as consultancies push reluctant employees...
